item.title: Britain Seeks Tech and AI Deal With US Rather Than Full FTA
item.description: The UK will look to negotiate a narrow trade agreement with the US focused on technology and artificial intelligence, rather than revive talks for a full free-trade deal of the sort that stalled during the first Donald Trump administration.

item.title: French Inflation at Four-Year Low Bolsters Case for ECB Cuts
item.description: French inflation retreated to its lowest level in four years, bolstering the case for further interest-rate cuts by the European Central Bank, whose next move is likely to arrive next week.

item.title: Europe Gas Ends Month With Biggest Loss in Year and Record Trade
item.description: European natural gas is ending February with the biggest decline in a year and record trading volumes as market players adjust their outlooks after a tumultuous month.

item.title: IAG Sets €1 Billion Stock Buyback as Profit Beats Estimates
item.description: IAG SA reported quarterly profit that beat analysts’ estimates and set plans to buy back €1 billion ($1.04 billion) in stock, signaling confidence in the longer-term strength of its business.

item.title: Kenya Inflation Accelerates to Five-Month High on Food Prices
item.description: Kenya’s annual inflation rate climbed to a five-month high in February as food prices continued to increase.

item.title: Goldman Strategists Warn of Risks for Credit as Tariffs Rattle
item.description: Investors should hedge corporate bond investments because yield premiums may widen if US President Donald Trump’s tariff threats continue to rattle markets, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.

item.title: Sweden’s Economy Grows at Fastest Pace Since 2022 on Exports
item.description: Sweden’s output unexpectedly grew at the fastest pace in 2 1/2 years, exceeding an initial estimate as exports and investments drove a long-awaited recovery of the largest Nordic economy.

item.title: Turkey Rebounds from Recession at the Onset of Rate-Cut Cycle
item.description: Turkey emerged from a technical recession in the fourth quarter, bolstering investors’ hopes for stronger growth this year, aided by interest-rate cuts.

item.title: India, EU to Push for a Trade Deal This Year, Says Von der Leyen
item.description: India and the European Union will try to seal a trade deal during this year, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Friday.

item.title: TikTok Boosts Thailand Investment Plans to $8.8 Billion
item.description: Chinese-owned video platform TikTok pledged to spend $8.8 billion building AI data centers across Thailand over the next five years, more than doubling an earlier investment target for the Southeast Asian nation.

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将下滑，英镑跌破 1.26 美元
Singapore Leader Defends Election Year Handouts After Criticism
item.description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong defended an election year budget featuring a list of handouts after opposition figures criticized the measures as a short-sighted solution for addressing rising living costs.

item.title: Finnish Economy Unexpectedly Shrinks as Private Sector Retreats
item.description: Finland’s economy surprised with a fourth-quarter contraction after nine months of expansion as consumers and businesses remain cautious.

item.title: India Needs 7.8% Growth to Become High Income, World Bank Says
item.description: India’s economy needs to expand at an average growth rate of 7.8% over the coming decades to become a high-income country, according to a World Bank report.

item.title: Holcim 预计利润增长，公布美国分拆业务财务数据
item.description: Holcim Ltd. 预计今年的销售额和利润率将有所增长，因为这家水泥生产商采取了一项关键措施，即在上半年结束前分拆其北美分部。【原文：Holcim Ltd. expects to grow sales and profitability this year as the cement maker took a key step to spin off its North American division by the end of the first half.】

item.title: Thailand Taps Baidu to Ease Chinese Tourists’ Safety Worries
item.description: Thailand’s tourism authority is partnering with a unit of China’s search engine giant Baidu Inc. to enhance the nation’s image as a safe travel destination and calm tourists unnerved over viral news about an alleged kidnapping of a Chinese actor.

item.title: Pimco 母公司启动新的回购计划，安联集团利润超预期
item.description: Allianz SE reported better-than-expected profit for the fourth quarter, as Chief Executive Officer Oliver Baete prepares to return additional capital to investors.

item.title: 巴斯夫预计今年大多数部门的盈利将有所改善
item.description: BASF AG expects earnings to increase slightly this year as sales for agriculture and nutrition products help offset sluggish demand for chemicals and coatings for the struggling auto industry.

item.title: Emerging Asia Markets Rattled as Trump Dials Up Tariff Threats
item.description: Emerging Asian markets got swept up in the global equities storm Friday, with Thai and Indonesian stocks teetering on the brink of a bear market as President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threats sent risk assets reeling.

item.title: 美俄解冻让投资者寻找制裁变通办法
item.description: 在曼哈顿中城的办公室里，证券律师格里戈里-马里尼切夫（Grigory Marinichev）正在接听来自世界各地客户的电话，并提出一个问题：我们如何在俄罗斯市场交易？【原文：From his office in midtown Manhattan, securities lawyer Grigory Marinichev is fielding calls from clients across the world with one question: How can we trade Russian markets?】

item.title: India Builds World’s Longest LPG Pipeline to Cut Costs, Mishaps
item.description: India’s state-run refiners will fully commission the world’s longest liquefied petroleum gas pipeline by June, a key development that will sharply cut fuel transportation costs and help prevent deadly road accidents.

item.description:
他们进退两难，但如果一定要赌，那就赌廉价石油吧。【原文：

item.title: Ever-Bearish Grantham Insists AI Is a Bubble Waiting to Pop
item.description: Artificial intelligence is pushing humanity toward a more efficient future, but like any world-changing technology will eventually crash and hurt investors, according to longtime Wall Street doomsayer Jeremy Grantham.

item.title: 杰里米-格兰瑟姆警告美股即将崩溃
item.description:

The famed value investor says on this week’s Merryn Talks Money that a “major decline” is imminent. “The longer and the higher they climb, the worse it is.”

item.title: 调查显示，特朗普曲线救国将考验欧洲央行利率的去向
item.description: 经济学家们对欧洲央行将再降息三次的观点大加挞伐：唐纳德-特朗普【原文：Economists have added a big disclaimer to their view that the European Central Bank will cut interest rates three more times: Donald Trump.】

item.title: 中国人民币升值推动银行融资利率升至八个月高点
item.description: 中国人民银行对人民币的支持预计将在未来几周内使银行的融资压力持续上升，因为流动性紧缩使衡量银行短期借款的一个关键指标升至 6 月份以来的最高水平。【原文：The People’s Bank of China’s support for the yuan is expected to keep banks’ funding pressure elevated in the next few weeks, as a liquidity crunch pushed a key gauge of their short-term borrowing to the highest level since June.】

item.title: 受芯片和关税影响，日本股市将迎来 2022 年以来最糟糕的一个月
item.description: 随着芯片相关企业加速下挫，以及对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税对全球经济影响的担忧加深，日本股市创下 2022 年以来的最大单月跌幅。【原文：Japanese stocks headed for their biggest monthly drop since 2022 as a selloff in chip-related firms accelerated and concerns over the global economic impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs deepened.】

item.title: 特朗普征税打击需求，铁矿石每周巨亏
item.description: 铁矿石有望创下 11 月以来的最大单周跌幅，原因是美国对中国进一步征收关税的前景再次引发了人们对全球贸易战愈演愈烈的担忧，从而打击了工业金属的投资情绪。【原文：Iron ore was on track for its biggest weekly loss since November as the prospect of further US tariffs on China rekindled concerns over a mounting global trade war, denting sentiment for industrial metals.】

item.title: 印尼控制煤炭价格的举措面临中国的反击
item.description: 印尼政府的煤炭出口价格管制计划正面临其最大客户的反对，因为其他供应商降低了价格，中国的企业不愿支付更高的成本。【原文：The Indonesian government’s plan to regulate the price of coal exports is facing pushback from its largest customer, as firms in China balk at paying higher costs as other suppliers lower their rates.】

item.title: 投资者希望新的印度市场监管机构保持简洁
item.description: 印度的资本市场监管机构正在经历领导层的更迭，而外资撤离的加剧正给当地股市的前景蒙上一层阴影。投资者的首要要求是：减少监管。【原文：India’s capital markets regulator is witnessing a change of leadership just as a deepening foreign exodus is casting a pall on the outlook for local stocks. The number one demand from investors: less regulation.】
